sen.e: Yoshitada YAMANA (date of birth and death unknown) was a Japanese military commander in Muromachi period.

sen.e: In 1391, Ujikiyo and Mitsuyuki YAMANA, Yoshitada's nephew, determined to launch a coup d'etat provoked by Seii-Taishogun (great, unifying leader) Yoshimitsu ASHIKAGA, who was attempting to weaken the Yamana clan.

sen.j: 氏清は義理の分国紀伊国を訪ねて同心を説得。
sen.e: Ujikiyo visited the Kii province under control of Yoshitada and persuaded doshin (police constables).

sen.e: Ujikiyo and Mitsuyuki raised an army and pushed into Kyoto City, but they were defeated, and Ujikiyo died on the battle field and Mitsuyuki ran away.

sen.e: Yoshitada did not dispatch an army and did mot move from the Kii province (Meitoku War).

sen.e: After the war, Yoshitada apologized to Yoshimitsu, but the shogun did not accept this and forfeited the Kii and Mimasaka provinces from him and gave them to Yoshihiro OUCHI and Yoshinori AKAMATSU respectively.
